sn2.4:1.2: The name is variously spelled māgha (like the previous Sutta) or māgadha, suggesting he is the god “of Magadha”—but we meet no such deity elsewhere. I think it should be corrected to Maghada, “giver of bounty”, cf. Rig Vedic maghadeya (7.67.9), indro maghāni dayate (7.21.7). I adopt this spelling even though it is, so far as I know, unattested in manuscripts. See also note on next Sutta.
